definition: to push aside/to part/to brush away
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: A nicked pearl opens a treasure of innovation.
sentences.chinese: 一個撥開的珍珠蚌打開了創新的寶藏。

sentences.english: IrritaBly, she elBowed a path through the streams of girls entering and leaving the gate.
sentences.chinese: 她急躁地從進進出出的姑娘羣中撥開一條道。

sentences.english: I will protect you and break open the crowds in your way like an ice-breaker in arctic sea.
sentences.chinese: 我要護著妳，撥開擋路的人羣如破冰船行在北極冰洋。

sentences.english: She brushed away the 28)bangs hiding my eyes and then pulled me against her breast.
sentences.chinese: 她撥開遮着我眼睛的劉海兒，一把將我摟進懷裏。

sentences.english: We're poking and quantitatively measuring the softness of the cells.
sentences.chinese: 我們撥開細胞並定量地測量其柔軟度。

sentences.english: I had to part the willow branches to get in;
sentences.chinese: 我得撥開柳樹叢的枝椏，這才進得去。

sentences.english: Find Road clouds are cleared, leaning against the tree, listen to gurgling flow of the springs.
sentences.chinese: 撥開雲霧尋找古道，靠在樹上細聽淙淙流動的泉水。

sentences.english: For prying beneath and forcing the lids of sight.
sentences.chinese: 窺伺俯望，撥開視界的眼瞼。

sentences.english: Out the portholes, Europe slipped over the horizon and the Carthage hit open water.
sentences.chinese: 舷窗外，迦太基號撥開水浪，歐洲逐漸消失在地平線。

sentences.english: After pulling off the shell, she observed the hard-boiled egg.
sentences.chinese: 撥開外殼後，他看到一個煮老的雞蛋。

sentences.english: Just as a black mouse pointer disperses them, "HP"is in sight.
sentences.chinese: 黑色鼠標指針將他們撥開，發現了“HP”。

sentences.english: Precious are God's words that unravel life's mystery and lighten my heart.
sentences.chinese: 神的話字字重千鈞，撥開迷霧照亮我的心。

definition: to extend one's head (out or into)/a probe/detector/search unit
making up a group, forming a troupe (idiom); in large numbers/as a large crowd
to chat with a low voice
to cut open/to rip/to streak across (lightning, meteor etc)/to pierce (scream, searchlight etc)
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
